title.narrative: 1.2: NUTRITION & Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: A conducive policy environment ensures mothers and children under five have enhanced knowledge for the increased uptake of nutrition services and for the increased adoption of appropriate behaviours, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Hygiene, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid), Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 80 per cent of pregnant women, new-borns and children less than five years of age and adolescents have access to high- impact quality maternal, new-born, child and adolescent health interventions including HIV and AIDS with a special focus on the most disadvantaged districts and communities.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)

Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A conducive policy environment ensures mothers and children under five have enhanced knowledge for the increased uptake ofnutrition services and for the increased adoption of appropriate behaviours

description.narrative: The implementation, coordination and monitoring of key nutrition policies, strategies and guidelines for the prevention and control of all forms of malnutrition among children were done across the key government departments of Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation, Health and Basic Education. Together with the capacity building activities for service providers and managers, it provided a more conducive policy and programme environment for increasing uptake of nutrition services and the adoption of appropriate behaviors by caregivers of children under five years across the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020
